awd_titl_txt: Intelligent Biology and Medicine in 2022: Enhancing Interdisciplinary Education, Collaboration, and Innovation in Data Science and Artificial Intelligence
awd_abstract_narration:
In the era of artificial intelligence and data science, covering data process and standardization, algorithm and tool development, statistics, machine learning and related approaches provide critical new opportunities for dealing with the amazing data growth rate. This coupled with new technologies leads to advances in health and biomedical research. The 2022 the International Conference on Intelligent Biology and Medicine (ICIBM) will be held August 7-9, 2022, led by a stellar field of keynote speakers to address themes of omics- and data-based systems, translational science and personalized medicine. The conference promotes extensive interaction and provides opportunities for junior faculty and students to participate and learn.
 
The mission of ICIBM is to promote information science, technology, and education to a great variety of trainees and young investigators, including trainees, faculty, teachers, scientists, and engineers, and to provide a forum for the cross-fertilization of ideas. ICIBM will provide a forum to accelerate data science method development and application, to explore complex and dynamic functions and regulation in cellular systems and organisms, and to improve algorithms, deep learning, computational tools, knowledgebase, and biotechniques for better diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of diseases. ICIBM 2022 conference programs will include four distinguished keynote speakers, eminent scholars' talks, flash talks for junior investigators, tutorial and workshop sessions, scientific presentations, a poster session, and other activities. Top manuscripts will be selected for special journal issues.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering

inst.inst_name: The University of Texas Health Science Center at Houston
inst.org_lgl_bus_name: UNIVERSITY OF TEXAS HEALTH SCIENCE CENTER AT HOUSTON

por.por_cntn:
ICIBM 2022 was successfully held as an in-person conference at Philadelphia, Pennsylvania on August 7-9, 2022, because of the improvement of COVID-19 pandemic. The conference website is available at https://icibm2022.iaibm.org/. The fund was used to partially support these conferences including travel awardees and invited speakers. ICIBM 2022 attracted 276 registrants and other volunteers who contributed to four workshops/tutorials, four keynote speeches (three are female scientists), six Eminent Scholars’ speeches (included one minority speaker), 99 scientific podium presentations in 12 concurrent scientific sessions, and 24 poster presentations. We received 51 original paper submissions and 76 abstract submissions. We are in the process of publishing four special issues. The program added two Flash Talk sessions and a session “Artificial Intelligence on Big Data: Promise for Early-stage Trainees”, which offered unique opportunities for young or early-stage trainees including college and high school students to engage ICIBM and interact with senior investigators. This NSF grant supported 20 travel awards in ICIBM 2022 to trainees from diverse backgrounds. Selection of these awardees was based on the quality of the research (paper or abstract, first author), the financial need, diversity/minority of the attendees, geographic locations, among others. These travel awards encouraged the participation of young scientists in training from a diverse array of both scientific and societal backgrounds. All the travel awardees were able to attend the conference and presented their work. An award ceremony was given during the ICIBM 2022 conference. The selected pee-reviewed papers were invited to resubmit to four special issues in journals: Cancers, Genes, Chemistry & Biodiversity, and Quantitative Biology, all of which are open access journals.


Last Modified: 07/01/2023
Modified by: Zhongming Zhao
